intro: Diosma pallida, commonly known as the pale diosma, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-shaped inflorescences. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its flowers are small and white, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Diosma pallida is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
